content: Great for organizing my craft and art photos. Easy to learn and allows info like camera type, lens, location, exposure and onward!

[Revised] This is a powerful EXIF Editor app, and I recommend it. Has email support. The best feature, is the filesystem date/time, which uses the EXIF modification date/time when the file is saved. Two negatives: (1) It saves the image file without any warnings, overriding the original file and why it needs a Warning Message when saving. (2) It can read the GPS Date/Time Stamp, but not edit it. On Android v9.0.
replyContent:
Dear,
Thanks so much for your feedback!
We will check it again.
Banana Studio Support

content: GREAT APP & SUPPORT!!

Exit editor - very useful when using manual lenses adapted to digital cameras. Using it with Android 5.1 on Lenovo Tab2 a50f but will not save data to SD card. Told support who was very quick to reply. Also told them that I could get by with a workaround switching my photos to internal and back as done on another tablet running 4.4. Guess that was my mistake, because was then told that I was out of luck, since 4.4 doesn't support  data to the SD card. Duh! Like I'm not running 4.4 but rather 5.1 (could be an internal problem in my particular 5.1 OS? anyway )which I corrected them on in an email. No response this time. Well aside from the misinterpretation still a very, very good app.

It allows me to modify exif data directly from my chosen picture viewer app (QuickPic for Me but others as well ) via the share facility. So simple and so elegant. I need help because I was aware of the mechanism. Support came back in a few minutes.  I just love it
Love it
Awesomeness, it lets you edit more than most I have encountered and simple to use

Works well, has a one click button to just remove all exif data at once. As well as ability to edit it. Many fields have drop down menus to select the value. Also does validation, so you won't put wrong values that aren't allowed by the specs and risk breaking the photo, depending on the software/camera (thanks for doing the research and putting all the data/strings together).Tried both, full clean up and editing every field that the app has (just to test it, put the values as if it's from a North Korean drone). Much better than using an online service to clean up the EXIF data (in fact, they must be avoided at all costs as they keep all your metadata, it's an advertiser's goldmine). I'll test it out on the computer later, just wanna look at a bunch at once for the patterns in hex, enough to fingerprint them and link to a particular camera. Nothing is perfect.. I've seen some forensic tools sold to police departments for a lot of money, and that stuff is unbelievable what it can do.

I don't submit a positive review on many things but this one thoroughly deserves these 5 stars. The developers ran the extra mile to adjust more meta data than the other apps and that's where it really counted for me. Thanks, Banana studio, kind if weird I used banana and thanks in one sentence but thanks again!

The app erase data from your photos. Keep your privacy. Make it harder for hackers  to social engineer you. Erase data from photos if you like to put your photos on your social media. Simple to use. With the Pro version you can browse and erase data from multiple photos at the same time.
Simple to use and meets my needs.

Doesn't do everything I want like the ability to add info that the image is to be displayed as a photosphere the ability to remember into so things like photographer and camera make/model can be automatically entered but it's great for adding location info and entering manual information.
It works

content: It works like a charm and looks great. If you've got a mangled photo that shows up wrongly in a timeline, this is the fix.
It can't read the image files.
replyContent:
Hi,
Currently Photo Exif Editor can only read JPEG (because Exif  specification uses the file formats: JPEG, TIFF and WAV).
Please read more at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exchangeable_image_file_format

Could you explain more about this problem by sending the details to support@xnano.net.
Banana Studio Support
